name: Thai Basil Chicken
description: Bring Thai-inspired street food vibes to your kitchen. Known in Thailand as Pad Kra Pao Gai, this dish is savoury, sweet, and mildly spicy. Even if you’re not a fan of fish sauce, add a few splashes to the dish at the end of cooking: it adds more depth and an irresistible, umami flavour! For an even more authentic Thai experience, serve the prepared dish with steamed rice and a fried egg.
preparation: Cut beans into 1" pieces. Set aside.
Heat oil in Wok over medium-high heat. Add chicken and seasoning; stir-fry 2 min, breaking up meat.
Stir in green beans and soy sauce; stir-fry 3 min, or until chicken is cooked. Add spinach, stir-fry until spinach is wilted. Stir in fish sauce, if desired.
tips: Swap chicken for pork, shrimp, or beef. For a veggie-forward dish, use mushrooms or eggplant!
